medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent parvovirus B19 infection and severe anemia in a patient with AIDS.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 32-year-old man, was initially diagnosed with HIV-1 infection in 1996. Anemia recurred when his initial course of highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) failed. Symptoms included severe anemia noted on multiple occasions, with a blood transfusion required monthly starting in February 1998. After salvage therapy began in June 1998, the chronic anemia gradually resolved, and blood transfusions were no longer necessary after November 1998.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV-1 infection diagnosed in 1996, persistent anemia attributed to parvovirus B19 infection, and a history of cryptococcal meningitis.
medical_history.social_history: Had sexual contact with commercial sex workers before immigrating to Taiwan in 1990.
